title: BBC Catching Historys Criminals The Forensics Story 3of3 Instrum
description:
Catching History's Criminals: The Forensics Story

History, Science Documentary hosted by Gabriel Weston, published by BBC in 2015 - English narration 
http://docuwiki.net/images/d/d7/Catching-History-s-Criminals-The-Forensics-Story-Cover.jpg

Information
------------------------------

Catching History's Criminals: The Forensics Story


.

3)  Instruments of Murder 
Where there's a murder there's usually a weapon. It's a key piece of evidence that can hold all the clues needed to catch the killer and shine a light into the mind of the murderer. In this final episode, Gabriel investigates the forensic advances that have elevated the murder weapon from its role of mere evidence to that of key witness. Arsenic, the undetectable weapon of choice in the 19th century, was exposed as the murder weapon with one simple chemical test, and distinctive marks left on a victim's skull led detectives to the murder weapon and the killer.
